worklogs.comment:
nevi-me commented on pull request #4167: ARROW-5180: [Rust] Initial support for Arrow File reader
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4167
 
 
   This adds initial support for reading Arrow files, with the following work outstanding:
   
   - [ ] Support reading lists and structs
   - [ ] DIscuss/consult on treatment of dictionary batches (I haven't checked if they work the same as Feather, so needs some more research)
   - [ ] Add enough tests (I'm still unsure of what the process should be for adding files, should they go to `arrow-testing`?)
   - [ ] Better error handling for cases we don't support (I littered `panic!()` around for now)
   - [ ] Add tests for the util functions that I added to `crate::ipc::convert`
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

nevi-me commented on issue #4167: ARROW-5180: [Rust] Initial support for Arrow File reader
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4167#issuecomment-484265851
 
 
   Hi @paddyhoran @andygrove @sunchao please review when you get a chance. We can place the reusable parts (validating headers, reading schemas and batches) in a common module when we work on the streaming format.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

fields.description: The overall ticket to keep track of initial IPC support

comments.body: We need some integration support to complete this

The initial work on Rust IPC support is now complete 🎉🥳

Wider dictionary support and integration testing are the next steps [~andygrove] [~paddyhoran]

Congratulations [~nevi_me] and thanks for all the hard work on this!

I am working on building a flight server with DataFusion over at [https://github.com/andygrove/datafusion-flight-poc/tree/master/rust] but would be happy to move this into the arrow repo as an example if that makes sense.
Seems like it could be a good idea if only to keep the Arrow-Rust community "hacking together" so to speak
